section.title: Frequently Asked Questions
section.subtitle: Find Answers to Common Questions
section.description: Everything you need to know about hair restoration procedures

what.question: What is hair transplantation?
what.answer: Hair transplantation is a surgical procedure that moves hair follicles from a donor site to a balding area.

candidate.question: Am I a good candidate?
candidate.answer: Good candidates typically have sufficient donor hair and realistic expectations about the results.

age.question: What is the ideal age for treatment?
age.answer: While there's no strict age limit, most patients are between 25-65 years old with established hair loss patterns.

duration.question: How long does the procedure take?
duration.answer: The procedure typically takes 6-8 hours, depending on the number of grafts.

pain.question: Is the procedure painful?
pain.answer: Local anesthesia is used, making the procedure virtually painless.

recovery.question: What is the recovery time?
recovery.answer: Most patients return to work within 3-5 days, with full recovery in 2 weeks.

visible.question: When will I see results?
visible.answer: Initial growth begins at 3-4 months, with final results visible at 12-18 months.

permanent.question: Are the results permanent?
permanent.answer: Yes, transplanted hair is permanent, though natural hair loss may continue.

care.question: What aftercare is required?
care.answer: Specific washing techniques and medications are prescribed for optimal results.
